UseCaseTitle: Autonomous Agent AI for Telecom Network Troubleshooting
Purpose: To autonomously identify, diagnose, and resolve telecom network issues in real-time, reducing operational overhead and improving service continuity.
ExecSummary: Telecom operators face increasing complexity in managing dynamic networks, with rising incidents, subscriber churn, and operational costs. Manual troubleshooting is slow and non-scalable. This solution deploys a multi-agent AI system that leverages LangGraph, Neo4j, and specialized lightweight models to handle network diagnostics autonomously.
ExecSummaryKeyAsks: Diagnose root causes with minimal human intervention
Reduce Mean Time to Repair (MTTR) and improve uptime
BusinessObjectives: Lower the cost of L1/L2 technical support
Enable proactive network issue detection and resolution
BusinessBenefits: Up to 50% reduction in average resolution time (MTTR)
Improved SLA compliance and customer experience
overview: This demo presents a fully autonomous agent-based system for telecom network issue resolution. Agents are trained to detect anomalies, correlate logs and telemetry, diagnose faults using graph reasoning, and initiate resolution actions through APIs or human-in-the-loop prompts.
business: Modern telecom networks are becoming increasingly complex with 5G, IoT, and cloud-native infrastructure. Manual diagnostics can�t keep up with scale or pace. Automating the troubleshooting lifecycle enables faster, consistent, and more reliable operations while reducing dependency on human experts.
approach: We leverage LangGraph to manage agent state transitions, Neo4j to model network elements and historical incidents, and Python-based micro-agents to perform diagnostics. Agents access contextual data via memory graphs and interact with external APIs or CLI-based systems to suggest or execute remediations.
BusinessDrivers: Accelerate root cause analysis and fix cycles
Reduce reliance on human L1/L2 support teams
Improve SLA compliance with real-time detection
Enhance service continuity and QoE for users
BusinessChallanges: High costs due to manual diagnostics and issue tracking
Delayed resolutions leading to SLA breaches
Fragmented data across tools and platforms
Lack of real-time visibility into service-impacting issues
FunctionalOverview: Anomaly Detection Agent: Continuously monitors for faults in logs and telemetry
Root Cause Diagnosis: Identifies likely failure points using KG reasoning
Remediation Orchestration: Suggests or executes corrective actions
Alerting & Reporting: Notifies support teams or auto-closes resolved tickets
Context Memory: Tracks issue history and recurring fault patterns

FunctionalComponentDetails.Description: Analyzes log streams and telemetry for real-time detection of faults and anomalies.
KeyFeatures: Supports structured (logs) and unstructured (alerts, alarms) data
BusinessImpact: Enables early detection before customer impact
Reduces time spent on manual log reviews

FunctionalComponentDetails.Description: Performs root cause tracing through a graph of devices, alerts, and historical cases stored in Neo4j.
KeyFeatures: Uses contextual data for hypothesis generation

SolutionOverview: A multi-agent system using Python-based agents and LangGraph
Streaming ingestion of logs and metrics
Closed-loop remediation with optional human review
dataflow: Logs and telemetry are streamed into the Anomaly Detection Agent, which flags issues and triggers the RCA Agent. Using Neo4j, the agent explores past similar cases and identifies root causes. Resolution steps are proposed via the Orchestration Agent and executed or escalated as needed. Status and memory are updated for future learning.
design: Agents operate in a containerized microservice model, each triggered by event-based workflows. LangGraph manages transitions between detection, diagnosis, and resolution. Contextual memory ensures continuity and traceability. System is extensible to multiple network domains (core, access, transport).
